snippet: Organizations supporting Mrs. Clinton have raised nearly $200 million, defying expectations that conservatives and corporations would dominate spending....
abstract: Outside political groups supporting Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton have raised over $200 million since early October, far outpacing handful of organizations backing her Republican rival Donald Trump; results have upended expectations that Citizens United decision would favor conservative and corporate groups; situation reflects Clinton’s ties to elite donors and her allies’ willingness to aggressively exploit 2010 ruling, as well as Trump's role in shutting off donations to his cause.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and RACHEL SHOREY

lead_paragraph: Organizations supporting Mrs. Clinton have raised nearly $200 million, defying expectations that conservatives and corporations would dominate spending.

headline.main: Outside Money Favors Hillary Clinton at a 2-to-1 Rate Over Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: Outside Money Favors Clinton at a 2-to-1 Rate Over Her Rival
